Entries.default: An uneasy feeling comes over you. You realize that your pack is quivering - gently, but insistently.
"Oh, gods. It's the egg."
[Pretend you don't notice it.]
As you rummage through your pack, your hands brush against what feel like moist eggshells, still warm from the departure of their erstwhile occupant.

Among your gear, an eyeball slowly opens. Then another. Then another.

Then another. 

Something pokes its head out and opens its tiny jaws, revealing a row of pointed teeth. It lets out a triumphant chirp.
As you press on, a slimy appendage extends from your pack and softly caresses the back of your neck.
"Whatever's in there better not eat my Captain's Banquet. I was saving that."
"Come along, then."
"Aren't you just an adorable little monstrosity!"
[Kill it.]
"If you can hunt rats, you're welcome aboard [Player Ship]."
"Concelhaut? Is that you in there?"
The creature runs its tongue across its teeth. It chirps again before diving back into the warmth and safety of your pack.

You pinch your fingers around the creature's neck. It leans into the gesture, trusting you all the while - even when you squeeze down and twist, snapping the fragile bone. 

The body goes limp.
"What? Did it look at you wrong or something, Watcher?"
"That was awful. I don't care how many eyes it had." Maia sighs through her nose.
You open your pack. The leering skull opens its eyes and shakes its head - somehow - and glances nervously toward the unseen depths of your belongings.
"Hey, it's looking at me. And also at you."
"What a fancy little gentleman! Can we dress it up? Wonder what it eats." Maia coos down the mouth of your pack while Ishiza quietly pouts at her heels.
"For once, it appears I am not the sole horror of your belongings."
